page.title: 19Education in Debenham.
page.content: The Primary School in Debenham derives its name from a seventeenth century benefactor,Sir Robert Hitcham.The present school was built in 1879.In 1965,the Modern School was opened, becoming a Junior Comprehensive in 1979.For Sixth Form courses,children go to Thomas Mills High School in Framlingham. Debenham is very aware of its past and a History Group meets regularly. The Church Register,dating from 1559, has been card-indexed and there are collections of old photographs. Both schools include local history and environmental studies in their work,making use of the Records Office in Ipswich,school log books and local places of interest.This term,High School children have published a book, "Ourselves in Suffolk",in which they have written about village life.
